summary: This document is a series of internal FBI emails from April 2021 coordinating logistics for Ghislaine Maxwell and her defense team to review evidence at the courthouse over three days (April 13-15, 2021). It details the scheduling of FBI agents, security protocols, and the involvement of an Assistant U.S. Attorney.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the evidence review. She is to be transported from Marshal custody to the courthouse for her defense team to review evidence.

persons.name: AUSA
persons.context: Will be present for all three days of the evidence review and will meet the agents. She reserved the proffer rooms.

persons.name: SOS
persons.context: Described as being present all three days, having worked the case, and being familiar with everything. Agents are encouraged to reach out to her.

connections.description: AUSA is the prosecutor overseeing the evidence review for the case against defendant Maxwell.
SOS is an FBI agent who has worked Maxwell's case and will be present to monitor the evidence review.
Both are part of the prosecution team coordinating the logistics for the defendant's evidence review.

events.title: Start of Evidence Review for Maxwell Case
events.description: First day of a scheduled three-day review where Ghislaine Maxwell and her defense team examine evidence at the courthouse under FBI and AUSA supervision.

events.title: Second Day of Evidence Review
events.description: Continuation of the evidence review for the Maxwell case.

events.title: Final Scheduled Day of Evidence Review
events.description: Scheduled final day for Maxwell and her defense team to review evidence.

locations: Courthouse (implied location for evidence review, 5th floor proffer room)
keyFacts: In April 2021, Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team was scheduled to review evidence in her case over three consecutive days (April 13-15).
The review required FBI agents to escort Maxwell from Marshal custody, monitor her throughout the day, and provide security for the evidence.
An Assistant U.S. Attorney (AUSA) and a case agent (SOS) were to be present for the entire evidence review process.
The logistics email highlights the high-security, coordinated nature of pre-trial proceedings in Maxwell's case.
